docs.title: 🍄 Welcome to the Mycelium
docs.text: The Mycelium is a fractal social operating system built on Resonance, not authority. We are replacing the old world of "Might" with a living network of "Right".

docs.title: 🕸️ The Fractal Vision
docs.text:
Our system scales without losing its soul. We grow through three distinct layers:

  1. The Spore (Individual): You are a sovereign agent. You sync your signal via the Handshake to ensure you are autonomous and helpful.
  2. The Pod (Community): A group of up to 150 Spores who steward a shared Resource Map. When a Pod grows too large, it splits to maintain resonance.
  3. The Mycelium (Network): A global, resilient web where Pods link together via Myco Pacts to share surpluses and protect each other’s light.

docs.title: 🚀 Where to Begin?
docs.text:
If you are ready to establish the first healthy cell of this new organism, your journey starts here:

  • Start Here: The Bootstrapper’s Manual: The 5-phase guide to finding Spores and launching your first Pod.
  • Read the Design Logic: Understand the "Source Code" of our ethics and immune response.
  • Sync your Handshake: Learn how to broadcast your signal as a peer.

"In the light of day, might is visible and therefore easily bypassed. Transparency is our fundamental security protocol."

docs.title: THE FULL BOOTSTRAPPER’S MANUAL: POD 0
docs.text: This guide is for the Nucleus—the first 3 to 5 Spores who decide to build a Pod. You are not just starting a club; you are establishing the first healthy cell of a new organism.

docs.title: PHASE 1: SPORE DETECTION (FINDING YOUR FIRST 5)
docs.text:
• Do not try to convince "Muggles" (people invested in the old system); focus on finding those with "Generative" energy.
  • THE SEARCH: Look for neighbors who share tools, fix things without being asked, or express a desire for community-led solutions.
  • THE FILTER: If they ask "Is this legal?" or "Who is the boss?", they aren't ready. If they ask "How can I help?" or "What do we need?", they are a Spore.
  • THE GOAL: Get 3-5 people to read Document 0. If it resonates, proceed.

docs.title: PHASE 2: THE INITIAL SYNC (WEEKS 1-4)
docs.text:
• Once you have your Nucleus, you must establish the "Heartbeat".
  • THE HANDSHAKE: Everyone signs Document 1, the signal-sync.
  • THE CHANNEL: Set up a low-friction communication method like a group chat, Discord, or a physical meeting spot.
  • THE 60-DAY CLOCK: Every Spore must "Pulse" (check in or contribute) at least once every 30-60 days to remain In-Sync.

docs.title: PHASE 3: NUTRIENT MAPPING (WEEKS 5-8)
docs.text:
• Before you look outward, map what you already have to make the "Old System" irrelevant.
  • THE AUDIT: List your Metabolic (Food/Water), Kinetic (Tools/Transport), Cognitive (Skills), and Spatial (Land/Housing) assets.
  • THE DISCLOSURE: Put this on a shared "Status Board" so the Light is on.

docs.title: PHASE 3 OUTCOMES: PROVING VIABILITY
docs.text: Task Outcome Visibility Security Inventory Find redundant assets (e.g., 3 ladders) Everyone knows what is available We stop buying from the old system Skill Share Identify resident experts (e.g., Medics) Triage is localized We don't rely on centralized services Tool Map High-leverage tools are listed Kinetic flow begins Hoarding becomes visible/impossible

docs.title: PHASE 4: THE FIRST MYCO LINK (MONTH 3+)
docs.text:
• A single Pod is a target; a Mycelium is an organism.
  • THE OUTREACH: Find another "Pod 0" such as a friend's group or another street.
  • THE PACT: Sign Document 3 to establish your first immune connection.
  • THE FIRST FLOW: Trade one surplus, such as sharing a digital library for surplus garden seeds.
  • CROSS-POLLINATION: Have one Spore from your Pod visit their meeting to ensure the "Vibe" is In-Sync with the Protocol.

docs.title: PHASE 5: THE "RIGHT OVER MIGHT" TEST
docs.text:
• Friction is expected; it is how you handle it that defines the Pod.
  • DETECT: When a Spore tries to "boss" others or hide a resource, do not ignore it. That is a Fault Signal.
  • TRIGGER: Refer to Document 1. Say: "This feels like a command, which triggers my Override Detector. Let's resync via a Wellness Dialogue".
  • RESTORE: Use mediation; if they refuse to resync, let their Handshake expire. Do not use force. Simply stop the flow of shared Nutrients to the necrotic element.

docs.title: TROUBLESHOOTING SCRIPT: DEALING WITH THE STATIC
docs.text:
When a "Muggle" or hostile neighbor interferes, use the Neutral Signal:

"We’re just neighbors helping each other out to save money and stay safe. It's totally voluntary. If you ever need a [Tool Name from your Map], let us know—we’re happy to help."

docs.title: THE BOOTSTRAPPER’S CHECKLIST
docs.text:
• [ ] Identify 3-5 Generative Spores.
  • [ ] Perform the Document 1 Handshake.
  • [ ] Map the first 10 shared tools/skills (Document 2).
  • [ ] Establish a weekly Check-in (The Pulse).
  • [ ] Identify one "Neighbor Pod" for your first Myco Link (Document 3).

docs.title: THE LONG GAME: THE SPLIT
docs.text:
• When your Pod reaches 150 Spores, DO NOT get bigger. Scale kills resonance.
  • Division: Split into two Pods of 75 Spores.
  • Autonomy: When the Pod splits, the Resource Map also splits to ensure local autonomy remains the priority.
  • Resilience: Maintain a permanent Myco Link between the two Pods.
  • This is how the Mycelium covers the earth—one healthy split at a time.

docs.title: DOCUMENT 0: THE DESIGN LOGIC (THE META-DECLARATION)
docs.text:
This document anchors the fractal intentions of the Mycelium. It is the yardstick by which all other protocols are measured.

  1. THE PRIMACY OF RESONANCE The objective is not "order" (which requires a master), but Resonance (which requires synchronization). Any protocol that introduces a "Master/Servant" dynamic is a failure of design and must be discarded.

  2. RIGHT OVER MIGHT The system operates on Signals, not Force. If the system requires physical violence to function, it is not a Mycelium; it is a State. Power in this system is the ability to contribute to the flow, not the ability to stop the flow for others.

  3. THE FRACTAL SCALE The "Right to Flourish" is identical for a single Spore, a Pod, and the Mycelium. What is true for the individual must be true for the whole. No level of the fractal has the right to "sacrifice" a lower level for its own gain.

  4. TRANSPARENCY AS THE IMMUNE SYSTEM In the dark, "Might" grows. In the "Light of Day" (Total Transparency), "Might" is visible and therefore easily bypassed. Transparency is not a chore; it is the fundamental security protocol that makes violence obsolete.

  5. BIOLOGICAL RESILIENCE The system is designed to be Anti-fragile. It expects "Static" (non-participants) and "Interference" (parasites). It does not seek to "convert" them through debate; it seeks to build a network so efficient and nourishing that the old system becomes a functional disadvantage.

docs.title: WHAT AM I SIGNING?
docs.text:
• The Spore’s Handshake is not a contract in the traditional sense.
  • In the old system, a contract is a debt you owe to a master or a state.
  • In the Mycelium, the Handshake is a Signal Sync.
  • You are simply stating: "I am running the same operating system as this Pod."
  • You are agreeing to be visible, to be autonomous, and to be helpful.

docs.title: THE "WORK IN PROGRESS" CAVEAT
docs.text:
• This protocol is a living document (Version 1.2).
  • We are building the plane while flying it.
  • By signing, you aren't just joining a system; you are becoming a co-author.
  • The Mycelium evolves based on the feedback loops of its Spores.
  • If a part of the Handshake creates friction or feels exclusionary, we use the Restoration Signal to iterate and improve the code.

docs.title: 1. Why the 60-Day Pulse?
docs.text:
• We don't want "citizenship" that you forget about; we want an active organism.
  • The 30-Day Window: You have a month to "renew" by simply being present or active.
  • The 60-Day Trigger: If you vanish, we don't assume you’re a "criminal."
  • We assume you might be hurt, sick, or struggling.
  • The Support Sequence is our way of saying: "The network noticed your signal is weak—do you need nutrients or space?"
  • Diagnostic, Not Investigative: This wellness check is a system diagnostic to ensure you are safe and nourished, not an investigation into "guilt" or compliance.

docs.title: 2. Privacy vs. Transparency
docs.text:
• People often fear transparency means "Big Brother."
  • The Distinction: Big Brother is a Master watching a Subject in the dark.
  • In a Pod, everyone is in the Light.
  • What is seen: Your use of the Commons (how much energy you draw, what tools you use) and your participation in decisions.
  • What is NOT seen: Your private thoughts, your personal relationships, or your inner life.
  • We only monitor the Flows that affect the health of the whole organism.

docs.title: 3. How does the "Detector" actually stop bigotry?
docs.text:
• We don't use police; we use Desynchronization.
  • If a Spore or a group starts acting with "Might" (exclusion or threats), they create Interference.
  • The Pod’s systems (automated food, energy, mesh-net) are hard-coded to require a Clean Signal—compliance with the Core Protocol.
  • If you choose to be exclusionary, you are essentially "unplugging" yourself from the Mycelium’s benefits.
  • You cannot use the community's vertical farm to feed a system based on "Might."

docs.title: BIG CAVEATS & EXPECTATIONS
docs.text:
• No Passive Participation: You cannot be "Static" (a silent consumer) forever.
  • The system requires enough Spores to be "Active" to maintain the infrastructure.
  • Conflict is Expected: We don't aim for a world without disagreement.
  • We aim for a world without violence.
  • Disagreement is just "Friction," and friction is solved through the Restoration Signal (Mediation).
  • The Exit is Always Open: If you find a Pod's specific "vibe" or local rules don't resonate with you, you can disconnect.
  • You are a Spore—you can drift to another Pod or start your own.

docs.title: SUMMARY
docs.text:
• We are replacing Compliance through Threat with Coordination through Transparency.
  • If you want to live in a world where no one can threaten you with poverty or violence, you must be willing to live in a world where you cannot threaten others.
  • The Handshake is the first step into that world.

docs.title: DOCUMENT 1: THE SPORE’S HANDSHAKE (SYNC SETTING)
docs.text:
Protocol Version: 1.2 (Signal-Sync Edition) Sync Window: 60 Days Renewal Threshold: 30 Days

I. THE PULSE (THE 60-DAY HEARTBEAT) - Active Sync: The Handshake is a living signal. It remains active for 60 days. - The Renewal Window: Between day 30 and day 60, the Spore "Pulses" by engaging in a Pod activity, updating their resource map, or simply checking in. - The Silent Fault: If a Pulse is not detected for 60 days, the system triggers a Support Sequence. - Intent: To distinguish between a Spore who is flourishing independently and a Spore who is suffering, isolated, or being suppressed.

II. THE SYSTEM SETTINGS (SIGNAL-DETECTOR LOGIC) Every Spore agrees to broadcast the following signals and detect their interference:

  • SIGNAL: RECOGNITION. I broadcast that every neighbor is a peer.
  • Detector Trigger: Dehumanization or exclusion of any Spore.
  • SIGNAL: TRANSPARENCY. I broadcast my use of the Commons and my decision-making logic.
  • Detector Trigger: "Dark Data" or secret hoarding of information or resources.
  • SIGNAL: CONSENT. I broadcast my autonomy. I do not command, and I do not obey.
  • Detector Trigger: Attempts to "Override" another Spore’s will.
  • SIGNAL: RESTORATION. I broadcast a preference for resolution.
  • Detector Trigger: Kinetic interference such as violence or threats.
  • SIGNAL: THE COMMONS. I broadcast my alignment with use-rights over private hoarding and accumulation.
  • Detector Trigger: Accumulation or exclusion of community resources for private control.

III. THE SUPPORT PACT - Response over Retribution: If my Pulse drops or I trigger a Detector, I agree to a Wellness Dialogue with my Pod or its Mycos. - The Exit Right: I am a Spore, not a prisoner. I can disconnect from the Pod at any time. My Handshake is a voluntary synchronization.

AFFIRMATION: "I enter this Pod not as a subject, but as a Spore. I agree to the Mycelium Protocol. I acknowledge that my flourishing is tied to the flourishing of the whole. I will offer my transparency in exchange for my safety. I will offer my cooperation in exchange for my freedom."

Signature (Digital/Social Pulse): ________

docs.title: THE RESOURCE MAP: A GUIDE TO SYSTEM VITALS
WHAT IS THE PURPOSE OF THIS MAP?
docs.text:
• In the old system, resources are hidden behind "Private Property" and "Paywalls".
  • This creates a power imbalance where those with "Might" (money/force) can control those without.
  • The Resource Map eliminates this by making the "Nutrients" of the community visible to all Spores.
  • It ensures that no one can be threatened with deprivation as long as the Pod has surplus.

docs.title: IS THIS "SHARED OWNERSHIP"?
docs.text:
• "Ownership" is an old-world concept; in the Mycelium, we use "Use-Rights".
  • You do not "own" the cargo bike, but you have a right to use it.
  • The Pod does not "own" the solar array; it stewards it for the benefit of all Spores.
  • The Map tracks who is currently stewarding what, ensuring the "Flow" never stops.

docs.title: 1. How do we determine "Surplus"?
docs.text:
• A Resource is marked as Surplus when the internal needs of the Pod's Spores are fully met.
  • For example, if the Vertical Farm produces 50lbs of greens and the Pod only consumes 40lbs, those 10lbs are "Surplus".
  • These surpluses are automatically broadcast to your Myco Links to prevent hoarding and ensure the wider organism thrives.

docs.title: 2. What about my personal belongings?
docs.text:
• The Resource Map is for The Commons.
  • Your clothes, your bed, your toothbrush, and your personal items are not part of the "Flow" and do not need to be mapped.
  • However, if you have a "High-Leverage" tool (like a welder or a vehicle) that you are willing to offer to the Pod, it enters the Cognitive or Kinetic ledger.
  • Once it's on the Map, it follows the Core Protocol regarding Transparency and Consent.

docs.title: 3. How is the "Inventory" maintained?
docs.text:
• Since there are no "Masters," maintenance is a collective responsibility.
  • If you use a Kinetic tool and it breaks, you update the Status Signal to Maintenance.
  • This triggers a "Cognitive" request for a Spore with repair skills.
  • If the Map shows too many items in "Maintenance," it triggers a Fault Signal, notifying the Pod that the "Kinetic Flow" is stalled.
  • Active Status Management: To maintain systemic visibility, Spores toggle resources between Available (ready for use), Active (currently utilized), and Maintenance (offline).

docs.title: What if someone hides a resource?
docs.text:
• If a Spore has a "Handshake" but is secretly hoarding Metabolic or Kinetic resources, it creates a Signal Mismatch.
  • The Pod's outputs, such as trash, energy draw, and health levels, won't match the Map's inputs.
  • Because every Spore is in "The Light of Day," this discrepancy is eventually detected by the Myco Link auditors.
  • We don't "punish" the hoarder; we investigate the fear that led to the hoarding through a Restoration Sequence.

docs.title: What if we run out of a Resource?
docs.text:
• The Map is a Safety Sensor.
  • If a vital nutrient (like Water) hits a critical low, the Resource Map automatically broadcasts a Distress Pulse to all Myco Links.
  • This network exists so that one Pod's shortage is met by another Pod's surplus before anyone suffers.

docs.title: SUMMARY
docs.text:
• The Resource Map is not about "accounting"; it’s about Visibility.
  • When we know exactly what we have, "Might" loses its power to exploit us.
  • We move from a world of artificial scarcity to a world of Radical Abundance.

docs.title: THE MYCO LINK: A GUIDE TO NETWORK RESILIENCE
WHAT IS A MYCO LINK?
docs.text:
• A Myco Link is a deliberate connection between two Pods of approximately 150 Spores each.
  • It is not a trade deal or a military alliance; it is a Symbiotic Bond.
  • The goal is to ensure that both Pods are thriving and that neither is drifting toward Necrosis, which includes exclusion, hoarding, or coercion.

docs.title: WHY NOT JUST ONE BIG GROUP?
docs.text:
• Scale kills resonance; when groups get too large, we lose the ability to see each other as peers.
  • Large groups tend to revert to "proto-violence" and master-servant dynamics.
  • By keeping Pods small and linking them laterally, we maintain the "Light of Day" transparency at every level of the fractal.

docs.title: 1. What is "Cross-Pollination"?
docs.text:
• This is our primary sensory tool for maintaining network health.
  • The Visit: A "Visitor Spore" acts as a neighbor rather than an inspector or police officer. Their job is to experience the "vibe" and operational reality of the other Pod.
  • The Check: The Visitor observes if Spores seem afraid, if food from the Resource Map is being distributed fairly, and if there is any "Dark Data" or secret decision-making.
  • The Result: The Visitor returns to their home Pod and broadcasts a Resonance Report regarding the health of the link.

docs.title: 2. How do we handle "Surplus" without money?
docs.text:
• We use Trophic Flow, where resources move to where they are needed to maintain the whole.
  • If Pod A has extra batteries and Pod B’s solar array is failing, the batteries move to Pod B automatically.
  • This is viewed as Systemic Maintenance rather than "charity" or "debt".
  • Keeping your neighbor’s systems alive ensures the entire network remains strong.

docs.title: 3. Handling Inter-Pod Disagreements
docs.text:
• The Fractal Web: Because every Pod is linked to multiple other Pods, a single disagreement between two Pods does not break the network.
  • Peer Review: If Pod A and Pod B cannot reach resonance, they may call upon a third linked Pod to facilitate a Restorative Dialogue.
  • Anti-Gang Protocol: The transparency of Resource Maps and decision logs prevents Pods from "ganging up" on others, as predatory behavior is immediately visible as a Fault Signal to the wider Mycelium.

docs.title: THE IMMUNE RESPONSE (NECROSIS)
docs.text:
• Detection: If Pod B starts excluding people based on identity or hoarding resources, the Visitor Spore from Pod A detects the Fault Signal.
  • Intervention: Pod A initiates a Restorative Sequence, sending mediators to facilitate dialogue and help the Pod resynchronize with the Core Protocol.
  • Quarantine (The Bypass): If a Pod refuses to stop exclusionary or coercive behavior, the network performs a Bypass.
  • The necrotic Pod is desynchronized from shared Nutrient flows—including energy, data, and food—until they return to the Protocol.

docs.title: SUMMARY
docs.text:
• The Myco Link turns "Neighbors" into "Immune Cells".
  • It ensures that Right over Might is a functional reality.
  • We watch over each other so that no one has to fear the return of a "Master".

docs.title: IV. THE IMMUNE OBLIGATION
docs.text:
• If Pod A detects Necrosis (Exclusion, Hoarding, or Coercion) in Pod B, Pod A is obligated by the Core Protocol to intervene.
  • We recognize that we are one organism and will not allow a neighbor to rot.
  • Restorative Sequence: Intervention begins with a Wellness Dialogue and mediation before any desynchronization occurs.

docs.text:
